instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H_REG: What is PP3V42_G3H_REG? PP3V42_G3H_REG is another way to say PP3V42_G3H. PP3V42_G3H_REG and PP3V42_G3H are a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: 820-000165 turn on, not video
threads.message:
this board turn on fan, but not video, not usb data. I already programmed bios, problem persists

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL>= 3.43                                        
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.6
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>=5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>=3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>=1.05
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>=1.2
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>=1.81
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL>=1.81
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.3V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.3V

Any history? 
I had changed it a short time ago <CAPACITOR>C7400</CAPACITOR> in short and also <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> because it did not turn on, it worked well for a week and returned to the workshop

threads.title: 820-000165 turn on, not video
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
You can try heating CPU, adding quality flux; in case of accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: 820-000165 turn on, not video
threads.message: I had already heated up the cpu, I already looked at the spi bus resistors they seem to be fine and traces

threads.title: 820-000165 turn on, not video
threads.message:
There is a communication issue, once platform reset is released.
Very likely CPU problem.
Check if all voltages from page 11 are present.
